intro: Leichhardtia tumida, commonly known as the woolly sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Leichhardtia tumida is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is often found in coastal and inland regions of Australia.
